Starting Out:


Volumizer is an app which automatically adjusts your music volume for you, after you do so the first time through, saving the volume level whenever you switch to the next track.

 If you want to change the assigned volume level, you need only change the volume going through part of the song, skip to another track, then play part of the first song again, repeating the change you made the first time through. 


Setup and Use:


In order for the volume tweaker to work, you need to put all of your music files in one folder on your phone. the default directory for this is '/storage/sdcard1/Music', but you can change this to whatever you want in the settings menu.


If you want your music tracks to be louder or quieter, overall, you need only turn the volume up or down for any of your songs, and volumizer will take that change into account and apply it to all subsequent tracks played so long as the volume tweaker is on. Unless you make the same exact volume change the number of times in a row(the default is 2) you specify in the settings, you won't have to worry about any volume changes you make affecting the song you're playing.


If you change a songs' volume, and then make the opposite change for the next one, the second songs' volume change won't be saved, but the first will be, so you don't have to go out of the way to correct a mistake you made in setting the initial volume of a track.


Finally, to back up all saved volume configurations, see the 'Backup/Restore' section in the settings menu.

The files containing all volume configurations is located in /data/data/badmexican333.volumizer17/databases. In order to backup your volume levels, simply backup these files using a file explorer or replace them with a previous backup in order to restore them.

You can set the directory here where you should keep all of your music files for Volumizer to see them.


The default filepath is "/storage/sdcard1/Music", which is on your phone's external sd card.
